subject: Communication
title: Bayesian Thinking: Updating Your Beliefs
description: A quick win: understand Bayesian Thinking: Updating Your Beliefs.

hook.text: You think there's a 10% chance of rain. Dark clouds appear. Do you jump to 90%? Or update gradually?

buildup.text: Bayes' theorem: update your beliefs proportionally to the strength of new evidence.

discovery.text: Bayesian thinking prevents both stubbornness (ignoring evidence) and credulity (flipping completely on weak evidence).

twist.text: Most people either don't update at all (confirmation bias) or update too much (recency bias).

climax.text: You don't need the math. The mindset is enough: 'How confident was I before? How strong is this evidence?

punchline.text: Strong opinions, loosely held. Update when the evidence warrants it.

quiz.question: What does Bayesian thinking help you do?
options: Update beliefs proportionally to evidence strength
